142001.name: Barbarian Rage Powers
142001.description:
From publisher blurb:

Sometimes, all you need to have fun with a class for another few months is a few new ideas to tinker around with. Class Expansions is a series of lightweight supplements for The Pathfinder Roleplaying Game that takes a base class and offers alternative class features that, handily enough, each fit on one page or less.

Following in this vein, Class Expansions: Barbarian Rage Powers introduces, funny how this works, twenty-one new rage powers.

Think of these descriptions as fortune cookies, but use "...while raging" instead of "...in bed".

Aligned Fury - Your attacks carry your alignment.
Bone-Hewing Strike - As a standard action, hew bone and stagger a foe.
Burning Hatred - If dealt enough damage by a single blow, your next round of raging is free... if you attack whoever hit you that hard.
Burning Hatred, Greater - If dealt enough damage by a single enemy, your next round of raging is free... if you attack whoever hit you that hard.
Crushing Blows - You treat your base attack bonus as 2 higher for the purpose of Power Attack.
Crushing Blows, Greater - As Crushing Blows, but 4 instead.
Extraplanar Embodiment - Gain a bonus to your DR, but the type changes from / - to one based on your alignment.
Fearful Display - Intimidate everyone in a radius around you.
Fury Made Placid - You gain a bonus to saving throws while using your moment of clarity rage power.
Grip with the Teeth - Hold onto ladders, ropes, walls, and the like with your teeth so you can use that greataxe midclimb.
Inexorable Advance - Treat difficult terrain as standard terrain.
Lingering Fear - You don't always demoralize, but when you do, the shaken effect lasts 1 round longer.
Momentum Charge - Leap into a charge, gaining a bonus to hit based on your Acrobatics skill.
Reprieve from Rage - Moment of clarity can be used for any number of consecutive rounds.
Schadenfreude - For one round per day, gain a temporary hit point whenever a creature is damaged.
Spellsiphon - Retroactively take a "1" on a saving throw against a spell to be the sole target of the entire spell.
Swim through Anything - Swim through anything remotely liquid and substitute your Swim check for other checks used to escape the clutches of remotely liquid hazards.
Uncultured Savage - Resistance to art, culture, and literature-themed spells.
Unexpected Retaliation - Throw your melee weapon at a ranged attacker as an immediate action.
Unyielding Passion - The Diehard feat becomes Diehard-er.
Vital Blood- +2 bonus to saves against sleep effects. +2 morale bonus to damage for 1 round whenever one is resisted.

142002.name: The Tinker: Master of Modular Mechanical Mayhem
142002.description:
From publisher blurb:


BECOME THE SQUAD COMMANDER!

For some, the smell of oil is akin to that of a fine perfume, the rush of invention is the only motivation one needs, and the eternal battle against corrosion is a constant annoyance. These individuals, the tinkers, are exemplars of the unfettered creative spirit. It is this creative spirit, the constant thirst for new ideas, that propels them to seek the unknown, whether it be found in a library or in the dark depths of an ancient tomb. Supported by a vast array of custom automatons, an experienced tinker, while not a fierce combatant on his own, commands an exceptionally versatile squadron that more than makes up for his own deficiencies.

The Tinker: Master of Modular Mechanical Mayhem is the end result of months of playtesting and development. Presented herein is the Tinker base class, an individual who can be described as a "non-spellcaster spellcaster". The domain of the tinker is the mundane. While others dominate the battlefield with arms and arcane might, the tinker does so through mechanical means.

The tinker's greatest asset is the variety of machines he can bring to bear in a fight. Small, mindless automatons make up the bulk of this power, but experienced tinkers are capable of building autonomous Alphas that act as the tinker's #2. Sentient, the alpha can eventually learn to order around the automatons so the tinker doesn't have to. Further, truly skilled tinkers are followed around by a swarm of nanobots. This swarm is capable of rending most any material into its constituent pieces and then rebuilding it into something useful. Many of the dragonscale breastplates that exist in the world today were crafted from a dragon in six seconds flat by a tinker swarm.

To allow for maximum modularity, the tinker has a brand new magic-like system: inventions! Tinkers can learn inventions, place them into blueprints, and then deploy automatons based on those blueprints.

This product features:

The Tinker base class
Progression tables for the tinker, his automatons, and his alpha
4 feats
21 innovations (talents)
12 greater innovations (greater talents)
121 inventions with full summary invention list
Dozens of pregenerated automaton configurations to get the creative juices flowing

142003.name: Beyond the Void
142003.description:
From publisher blurb:

Beyond the Void provides a terrifying addendum to the darkest edges of reality and their sanity-rending intersections with the mortal world. This rules supplement deals with the contact and summoning of alien entities whose dominions lie in realms of blackness beyond the stars. Sometimes the province of the dangerously curious, more often the patrons of the deliriously insane, these inhuman powers are utterly other, indifferent to human joy or misery, though always hungry and eager to devour any creature unwise enough to attract their attention.

Ideal for alchemists, summoners, and wizards, and for anyone wishing to delve into the sanity-rending realms of cosmic horror.This product includes three new character archetypes, the deranged alienist (summoner), the intrepid aquatic bathynaut (alchemist), and the far-sighted iridic mage (wizard). Add to this the Crawler in Darkness and Summon Star-Spawn feats; nine new spells from alien contact and cosmic communion to deform angularity and embryonic implantation; and the new alien and embryonic creature templates, including four sample embryonic aliens to terrify your players: the embryonic aboleth, embryonic intellect devourer, embryonic neh-thalggu, and embryonic shoggoth!

142004.name: Monstrous Bloodlines for Sorcerers
142004.description:
From publisher blurb:

Each sorcerer has a source of magic somewhere in her heritage that grants her spells, bonus feats, an additional class skill, and other special abilities. This source can represent a blood relation or an extreme event involving a creature somewhere in the family’s past. For example, a sorcerer might have a dragon as a distant relative or her grandfather might have signed a terrible contract with a devil. Regardless of the source, this influence manifests in a number of ways as the sorcerer gains levels. A sorcerer must pick one bloodline upon taking her first level of sorcerer. Once made, this choice cannot be changed. Below you will find seven additional monstrous bloodlines with which to customize your sorcerer.

Included are the following sorcerer bloodlines:

Cyclopean
Inevitable
Medusan
Otyugh
Sphinx
Stirge
Unicorn

142005.name: Monstrous Bloodlines for Sorcerers II
142005.description:
From publisher blurb:

Each sorcerer has a source of magic somewhere in her heritage that grants her spells, bonus feats, an additional class skill, and other special abilities. This source can represent a blood relation or an extreme event involving a creature somewhere in the family’s past. For example, a sorcerer might have a dragon as a distant relative or her grandfather might have signed a terrible contract with a devil. Regardless of the source, this influence manifests in a number of ways as the sorcerer gains levels. A sorcerer must pick one bloodline upon taking her first level of sorcerer. Once made, this choice cannot be changed. Below you will find seven additional monstrous bloodlines with which to customize your sorcerer.

Included are the following sorcerer bloodlines:

Couatl
Eidolon
Flail Snail
Flumph
Phoenix
Pugwampi
Time

142006.name: Monstrous Bloodlines for Sorcerers III
142006.description:
From publisher blurb:

Each sorcerer has a source of magic somewhere in her heritage that grants her spells, bonus feats, an additional class skill, and other special abilities. This source can represent a blood relation or an extreme event involving a creature somewhere in the family’s past. For example, a sorcerer might have a dragon as a distant relative or her grandfather might have signed a terrible contract with a devil. Regardless of the source, this influence manifests in a number of ways as the sorcerer gains levels. A sorcerer must pick one bloodline upon taking her first level of sorcerer. Once made, this choice cannot be changed. Below you will find seven additional monstrous bloodlines with which to customize your sorcerer.

Included are the following sorcerer bloodlines:

Aranea
Asura
Behemoth
Kami
Lamia
Mi-Go
Robot

142007.name: Fetchlings!
142007.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Amazing Races PDFs introduce new archetypes, feats, character traits, racial traits, and archetypes for the core, featured, and uncommon races described in the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game: Advanced Race Guide. Every PDF contains two full pages of high quality content (no fluff or filler)!

Amazing Races: Fetchlings! includes new racial feats, fetchling character traits, and alternate racial traits for fetchlings. In addition, this product features a new archetype for fetchling wizards: the Shadowmancer!

142008.name: Vishkanyas!
142008.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Amazing Races PDFs introduce new archetypes, feats, character traits, racial traits, and archetypes for the core, featured, and uncommon races described in the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game: Advanced Race Guide. Every PDF contains two full pages of high quality content (no fluff or filler)!

Amazing Races: Vishkanyas! includes new racial feats, changeling character traits, and alternate racial traits for vishkanyas. In addition, this product features a new archetype for vishkanya monks: the Venomous Disciple!

142009.name: The Radar Family
142009.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Radar Family is a short collection of three linked heroes: Radar Man, Sky Wave, and Sonar Girl

This release contains details three silver age heroes PL 10/8/10.

This is the 21th in a series of releases that will make up the final Deus ex Historica.

142010.name: Pulp Heroes
142010.description:
From publisher blurb:

Pulp Heroes is a short collection of three pulp inspired heroes: Cowboy Commando, Haymaker Jake, and Professor Hugo Hereafter

This release contains details three pulp-inspired heroes PL 10.

This is the 20th in a series of releases that will make up the final Deus ex Historica.

142011.name: Von Ärgers
142011.description:
From publisher blurb:

Von Ärgers is the classic Nazi mad scientist. It wouldn’t be a true representation of the Golden Age if you didn’t have a mad scientist creating evil devices to bedevil the heroes. Von Ärgers is not anything special outside of his mental resistances - he’s insanely brilliant but still normal.

This release contains details a golden age villain PL 6.

This is the nineteenth in a series of releases that will make up the final Deus ex Historica.

142012.name: Vivian of Aquitane
142012.description:
From publisher blurb:

Vivienne is cold and calculating witch, who hates just about everyone. She is a multi-generational villain who can appear in all times to bedevil the heroes; this Golden Age version is just an example. She could easily be used in earlier or later time periods.

This release contains details a golden age villain PL 10.

This is the eighteenth in a series of releases that will make up the final Deus ex Historica.

142013.name: The Wolves of the Coast
142013.description:
From the PDF:

When an Irish princess is captured by Viking raiders, only a
doughty band of Celtic heroes can rescue her.

An adventure and resource pack for Renaissance Deluxe

142014.name: A Fair Battleground
142014.description:
For centuries, the two kingdoms of F and B have fought each other in a peculiar way. Whenever war is declared, The Flag of The Old Empire is placed in the middle of The Ground, the contested borderland between the two kingdoms, and the two armies engage in battle to take control of The Flag and carry it into the opponent's lands: the first army to do so is declared victorious.

A Fair Battleground is a non-historical wargame set in a pseudo-Napoleonic era. To win, you must push the opposing army back or outmaneuver it, so that your own army can advance and eventually carry The Flag into the other player’s territory. Meanwhile, the opponent can engage you in battles to stop your advancement and try to take control of The Flag.

In A Fair Battleground, skillful deployment and maneuvering is more important than raw impact, but typical winning tactical moves of the era like attacking the opposing armies from behind are forbidden. Asymmetry between players is given not by a different mix of forces or objectives, but rather by the interplay of two pairs of opposing roles (Advancing vs Contending and Attacker vs Defender) that the two players take and exchange during the game. These roles determine both what the players can do and when they can do it, as well as which of the different armies are more useful to each of them.

Battle resolution is basically luck-less, but a simple optional rule that adds a random factor is provided for players who prefer luck-based systems.

---

A Fair Battleground is a print-and-play game that uses a board and 20 counters; the players must supply 9 euro-cubes or similar objects to be used as markers, and, optionally, two six-sided dice.

A Fair Battleground was an entry in the 2013 Two-Player Print-and-Play Design Contest.

142015.name: Pompker
142015.description:
Pompker is a "push-up poker". It's a pun in polish language, because it's a combination of words "pompki" (push-ups) and "poker".

The entire gameplay is similar to Texas Hold'em but there are some exceptions. The players do not have any starting amount of "money". Instead of money they bid with push-ups. During the game they can bid how much they want but bidding too much is a risk of losing. After finishing the round there is a winner who does not have to do the push-ups that he bid. All other players have to do the push-up according to how much they bid. The winning player gains as many points as all other players did push-ups in that round.

Each loosing player gains the points too (unless he passes and bids 0). He gains as many points as he did push-ups in that round.

If any player is not able to do the push-ups that he bid, he is out of the game and he scores minus points for the push-ups that he was supposed to do (e.g. if he bid 50 and he does 40, he gets -10 points).

The game end when all players but one are eliminated. The winner is not the last player in the game, but the player who scored the most points.

142017.name: Rotted Capes
142017.description:
From publisher blurb:


Death Never Held So Much Power

The Golden Age of Superheroes has ended, not with a BANG but with a BITE!

The Dead overran the world and humanity's protectors are missing, dead, or worst of all, Z'ed!

Once dismissed as the B-List Superhero, you are now mankind's last hope for survival in this horrific world where the Super Zombies sit atop the food chain, looking hungrily down upon you.

Survive the Zombie Apocalypse with:

Rules based upon the Origins-Award Winning Arcanis Roleplaying Game system
Power sets, gear, survival techniques, and a comprehensive skill system
A complete example setting: Paradigm City!

142020.description:
Legendary: A Marvel Deck Building Game has just become Fantastic! The Legendary: Fantastic Four expansion introduces Marvel's first family to the world of Legendary. Now you can play as fan-favorite Heroes: Thing, Mr. Fantastic, Invisible Woman, Human Torch, and Silver Surfer. Fend off the new evil Schemes of Masterminds like the world-devouring Galactus and the ever-elusive Mole Man!

Microbadge

Legendary: Fantastic Four fan
142020.name: Legendary: Fantastic Four

129437.name: Legendary: A Marvel Deck Building Game

142023.name: Bravely Default

videogamehonor.37492: 2013 Japan Game Awards Game of the Year Winner

142023.description:
"Bravely Default: Flying Fairy (ブレイブリーデフォルト Bureiburī Deforuto) is a 2012 role-playing video game by Square Enix for the Nintendo 3DS, a spiritual successor to the 2010 video game Final Fantasy: The 4 Heroes of Light. The game was developed by Silicon Studio, best known for the adventure game 3D Dot Game Heroes. The game’s job and battle system are similar to Final Fantasy V. It features augmented reality in the gameplay. On April 17, 2013, the game was announced to be released in Europe in 2013 and North America in 2014.

Gameplay

The game utilizes turn-based combat and multi-hit combination moves. The game utilizes cut scenes. There is a job system, similar to those in some other Square Enix games such as Final Fantasy V and Final Fantasy: The 4 Heroes of Light. The game has a single save slot, which Producer Tomoya Asano stated on Twitter is due to the game's "wireless features". The game will feature heavy use of voice acting within the story and during battles. Producer Tomoya Asano has said that the game will feature multiple endings. Also, thanks to an official Member's Site, the players can create a community, unlock achievements (otherwise impossible for the 3DS) and take on Quests created for the whole community."

Source: Wikipedia, "Bravely Default", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

142024.name: Bravely Default: Praying Brage
142024.description:
"A PC game has already gone into development called Bravely Default: Praying Brage that began an open beta November 11, 2012. The game takes place 200 years after the original game, will include a new cast of characters, and will be connected with the Nintendo 3DS game in some manner."

Source: Wikipedia, "Bravely Default", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

142025.name: Fallen City of Karez: Port of Karez
142025.description: The Fallen City of Karez: Port of Karez is a 6th player expansion for Fallen City of Karez.

142026.name: Fallen City of Karez: Burned Oak Tavern
142026.description: The Fallen City of Karez: Burned Oak Tavern a new building expansion for Fallen City of Karez that will introduce a new deck of cards, the Quest deck.

142027.name: Project X Zone
142027.description:
"Project X Zone (プロジェクト クロスゾーン Purojekuto Kurosu Zōn, pronounced "Cross Zone") is a crossover tactical role-playing game for the Nintendo 3DS co-developed by Banpresto and Monolith Soft and published by Namco Bandai Games. The game is a follow up to the 2005 video game Namco × Capcom and features characters from Namco Bandai Games, Capcom, and Sega. The game was released on October 11, 2012 in Japan and will be released in North America on June 25, 2013 and in Europe on July 5, 2013.

Gameplay

Stages in Project X Zone take place in grid-based locations from the game's many crossover titles. Each friendly unit is made up of two characters (thus referred to as a Pair Unit), though a third character (or "Solo Unit") can be added for once-per-battle assistance. Unlike Namco × Capcom, units can move freely within their range on the field map, with no penalty for accessing treasure chests or destructible objects prior to attacking.

The battle system is called the Cross Active Battle System, wherein pressing the A button in combination with the Circle Pad performs up to five basic attack combos. Additional gameplay elements include Support Attack, which allows the player to call in a nearby ally for assistance, and Cross Hit, which freezes the target in place during simultaneous attacks from multiple units. Also, the player can trigger Critical Hits by connecting their next attack just before the target hits the ground after the first. As the player's units deal damage, the player's Cross Power (XP) gauge fills up and can be used for special attacks and defensive moves on the map. Damage done via Cross Hits can fill this gauge up to 150%.

Project X Zone has a total of 15 save game slots included in the game, which can be used for recording a save game file during intermissions with a quick save file and a soft reset command."

Source: Wikipedia, "Project X Zone", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

142028.name: The Denpa Men 2: Beyond the Waves
142028.description:
User Summary

The Denpa Men 2: Beyond the Waves is the second title in the Denpa Men series of role-playing games for the Nintendo 3DS. Like the first game, Denpa Men can be discovered and captured by using the Nintendo 3DS' Alternate Reality features. The appearance and skills of the Denpa Men will vary according to local wi-fi signals. This sequel adds an overworld, additional combat and customization options, and a more fleshed-out story.

142029.name: Little Acorns
142029.description:
User Summary

As Mr. Nibbles, a squirrel with a hungry family to feed, you must navigate your way through many platforming challenges across all four seasons to gather enough acorns to sustain them.

142030.name: Extreme Edge Issue Twelve, Volume Three
142030.description:
From publisher blurb:


More of The Bleeding Edge!

Is it a magazine for showing Hot Chicks doing Extreme Sports? Or is it a secret communication to the warriors in the battle for the future and destiny of mankind?

Kale Fleigh, the enigmatic editor of Extreme Edge Magazine, isn't telling. But with any luck, the information in these pages will save the lives of some adventurers, or at least give them the chance to go down fighting!

In this issue...

Cover Girl Candy Knight; Triathelete, Lingerie Model, Big Game Hunter!
We Review the Sandler Seven-Cannon!
Fifi Reviews the Acoustic Torsioner!
Sierra's Words of Warning!
Editorial: Exit Strategy




When you live on the Extreme Edge, you're always a razor blade's width away from catastrophe... and you need a magazine that understands you. Welcome to the Extreme Edge!

142031.name: The Thing in Lab 34
142031.description:
From publisher blurb:


Some Things Should Stay Under Ground...

When the super-secret organization known as The Agency screws up, they screw up big. Even as they struggle to recapture their lost and rogue facilities, thse places have become breeding grounds for all manner of crimes and horrors.

When one of these laboratories accidentally creates a nigh-perfect predator of humanity, it's possible that not even The Agency can contain it. That's ok, though... that's what adventurers are for. Maybe some PCs can take care of the problem... or get eaten in the process!

See the layout of the Lab 34 facility, and read what it takes to create a horrible predator like no other. Learn what becomes of the victims of the Thing, and find out why, if it is not stopped, humanity may be in for a very bad time indeed!

142032.name: The Agency
142032.description:
From publisher blurb:


They've Always Been With You

Some people think they're a government agency, but they couldn't tell you exactly which government. Others think they're a mysterious inter-corporation taskforce on exploiting alien technology. The truth is stranger than any speculation.

Founded over two hundred years ago, The Agency watches over humanity and does its best to guard it against the coming darkness. Armed with advanced technology and an unparalleled communications network, their well-suited agents and paramilitary assets are ready to step between humanity and whatever comes our way.

Well, that's how it's supposed to work, anyways. Working entirely on their own with nearly unlimited funds, they may have gotten too big for their britches from time to time. After accidentally unleashing terrors like M.E.C.H.A.N. and Doctor Sul on an unsuspecting world, maybe the Earth would be better off without this kind of "protection!"

See the history and the inner workings of the mysterious organization known as The Agency. Meet the people who currently run it, and hope that their character flaws don't doom mankind! Included are new Psionic Disciplines, New Cyberware, new weapons, new ammunition, new armor, new miscelleanous equipment, specialized pharmaceuticals, and a bucket of high-tech, advanced Vehicles for all of your '80's action-movie needs!

Included are files on Agency Personnel; meet them as allies, face them as enemies, or simply try to figure out which is which!

142033.name: The Fae: A Dungeon World Playbook
142033.description:
From publisher blurb:

Some might dismiss you as foolish or unreliable. Some may say you’re nothing but a malicious trickster come to steal away their babies and their wives, and their husbands too! Some say you’re a delightfully strange creature with motives and values that simple mortals could never comprehend.

Okay, so it’s only you that says that last one. Nevertheless they’re all probably true! Sometimes. Depending on your mood, the season, and the phase of Fair Moon.

You are a Fae creature, traveled from your mystical half-real land to explore the alien world of the mortals. Some may curse you, some may laugh at your pranks and antics, but one thing’s for sure.

There’s no danger of dying of boredom when there’s a Fae around!

The Fae is a playbook designed for use with Dungeon World and Inverse World. As The Fae, you will be tricking your enemies with illusions, pranks, and tricks, blessing some with wishes, damning others with curses, and causing no end of mischief and trouble. But beware, every Fae has rules they must abide, and weaknesses that can cause them trouble. You will have to walk a fine line between causing trouble and solving it!

The Fae uses Drives and Aspects instead of Alignment and Race, an exciting new way to describe your character!

142034.name: The Spellslinger: A Dungeon World Playbook
142034.description:
From publisher blurb:

Magic’s got all sorts that practice it. It’s got lifelong scholars, weedy folk glued to books talking about theories and dynamics and whatnot. Magic’s got priests and sorcerer knights, saying their gift comes from a God on high blessing their acts and granting them power. Magic’s got all sorts of kooks believing and doing any number of crazy things.
Not you.
You know it doesn’t matter where magic comes from, or any philosophy about it. That’s just words to make other folks feel like they understand, like they’re in control. You know everything you have to learn about magic is how to sling it outta your wand and take down the other guy right quick. You know what you’re paid to do, you know how to do it, and you know what happens to anything that gets in your way.
The crown’s law might call you a criminal, an outlaw, a troublemaker. They can call you whatever they want. You know what you are, and anyone on the other end of your wands know what you really are too.
You’re a consummate professional.
The Spellslinger is a playbook for Dungeon World. It's a combination of fast and deadly wand combat, and wild west lone gunman antics.
The SpellSlinger has now been updated with new art, better fonts, and two free versions added into the package. These new versions have slightly different format, replacing Alignment and Race with two slightly different categories: Drives and Aspects.

Drives and Aspects are an exciting new look at Dungeon world classes that comes from the creators of inverse World, the upcoming book that will have a unique setting for use with Dungeon World. Keep your eyes open for Inverse World!

142035.name: The Medic: A Dungeon World Playbook
142035.description:
From publisher blurb:

Another hard day in Dungeon World. The Wizard blew his toes off, the Thief lost an eye, the Fighter took yet another ax to the shoulder. And then you had to perform that emergency operation on the attack zombie going for The Bard's squishy little arms, slicing off its jaw off before it could get a bite in. You sigh to yourself. You're The Medic, and these fools wouldn't last a day without your supervision.

The Medic is a playbook for the Dungeon World roleplaying game. She is a healer who ensures the party survives the most dangerous of circumstances. She can play as a pacifist, protecting the party as much as she can without killing, or she can be a mad doctor, using her medical knowledge to ensure every blow is deadly.

142036.name: Super Jetpack Dragon IV: Village Burntopia
142036.description:
User Summary

The player controls a jetpack-equipped dragon who runs, jumps and hovers through sidescrolling levels. Along the way, the player encounters villagers, who can be burnt to a crisp. The player gains points by torching villagers and collecting items.

142037.name: Family Farm
142037.description: A speed game where little farmers must quickly see if at least 1 of the 2 items depicted on a tile is in their own Farm, and eventually grab it before anybody else.

142038.name: One Shot
142038.description:
From the back cover:

One Shot is a two-player game of sacrifice and vengeance.

One Player portrays The Shooter: You have been wronged... Driven to the ends of yourself and left with only one goal: to get even. Permanently.

The other player embodies The Forces: You enable the Shooter, making sure that the shot can be taken... for a price.

Vengeance isn't clean. To be able to take ths shot, sacrifices must be made. Family, friends, those who would deter the Shooter, make them turn away.

But the chance is yours. Vengeful redemption gleaming like a single bullet in the stark lamplight.

So what are you waiting for?

You've got one shot. Take it.

boardgameintegration.160436: Lost Legacy: Binbo Tantei to Inbo no Shiro

142039.description:
Lost Legacy, an official spin-off of Love Letter, includes two sets of 16 cards: The Starship and Flying Garden. Players can use one set or the other or combine them in various ways to alter the powers available in the game. Shuffle all the cards together (other than the second "Lost Legacy"), and you can include up to six players in the same game. Cards from Lost Legacy can also be combined with Lost Legacy: Hyakunen Senso to Ryu no Miko and Lost Legacy: Binbo Tantei to Inbo no Shiro.


Rules Summary

Lost Legacy is a game of risk, deduction, and luck for 2–4 players. You start the game with one card in hand from a deck of sixteen cards. On a turn, you do the following:


Draw: Draw the top card from the deck and add it to your hand.
Play: Choose one of the two cards in hand to play and place it face up in front of you.
Effect: Carry out the played card's effect, after which the card is considered as discarded.
End: If there is at least one card left in the deck, the turn goes to the next player; if not, the investigation phase starts. Using the investigation speed indicated on the card each player has in hand, players take turns guessing which player (whether yourself or someone else) holds the "Lost Legacy" card; this card might also be in the "Ruins", a location that holds one card at the start of the game and possibly acquires more cards during play. The player who guesses correctly wins; if no one finds the Lost Legacy, then everybody loses.

boardgameversion.335866: English AEG Black Box 'Kanai Factory' edition

142039.name: Lost Legacy

142040.name: Scrabble: The Hobbit – An Unexpected Journey Edition
142040.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Are You Ready for an Adventure? Take an unexpected journey with The Hobbit Edition of Scrabble and discover a new way to play America's favorite word game. Choose between traditional Scrabble game play or add a Hobbit twist with bonus word plays and custom Adventure cards. Comes complete with custom letter tiles featuring The One Ring as the letter "O," a richly decorated tile bag and a Hobbit inspired game board.

142041.name: Monopoly: South Park Collector's Edition
142041.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Come on down to South Park and... battle to own it all! Howdy-Ho! It's the super-sweet South Park Collector's Edition of Monopoly! Join Stan, Kyle, Cartman, Kenny, Butters, and Chef and prepare to battle your way to the top of the quiet mountain town. Can you buy, sell and "Rochambeau" your way to victory? Fight for Imaginationland for $400 or settle for Canada for $60. Make your fortune and Cartmanland can be your very own private amusement park or lose everything and end as the poorest kid in town with nothing but Kenny's House. Grab your Super Best Friends and see who has what it takes to rule South Park!

142042.name: Guild02

videogamecompilation.141984: Attack of the Friday Monsters! A Tokyo Tale

142042.description:
"A follow up title, titled Guild02, was announced on May 24, 2012. The compilation features three games designed by Keiji Inafune, Kazuya Asano, Takemaru Abiko and Kaz Ayabe. These games have also been announced for Western release via the Nintendo eShop.

Attack of the Friday Monsters! A Tokyo Tale (怪獣が出る金曜日 Kaijū ga Deru Kinyōbi, lit. Monster Come Out on Fridays) is a life simulation game designed by Kaz Ayabe. The game follows a boy named Sohta who lives in a town where monsters and superheroes from 70s tokusatsu shows appear every Friday.

Bugs vs. Tanks (虫けら戦車 Mushikera Sensha) is a tank action game designed by Keiji Inafune. The game sees players take the role of various tanks that have been shrunk down to miniature size in order to fight against various bugs and insects.

Starship Damrey (宇宙船ダムレイ号 Uchūsen Damurei-gō) is a survival horror game designed by Kazuya Asano and Takemaru Abiko. The game throws players into a suspenseful environment with no tutorials or hints to guide them."

Source: Wikipedia, "Guild02", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

142043.description:
It's the middle of the Stone Age - food is sparse, rain falls from the sky when it is least wanted, and conflict stews among the council of elders. In an effort to better the lives of your people you have turned to worship. However, you're not the only one with that idea!

Neighboring tribes have started constructing monuments of their own, in an effort to turn the favor of the gods their direction. STACK your rocks and ATTACK your neighbors! The race to the top has begun!

Stack and Attack is a small-box strategy game designed primarily as a "filler" game between longer strategy games and for those who are just being introduced to the strategy board game genre. It combines elements of both modern (deck building) and classic (direct attack) board games.

During a players turn they spend their action points:

1) Acquiring rocks and effect cards from the quarry
2) Stacking rocks on their tower
3) Attacking another player's tower

The game ends as soon as a player reaches a tower height of 15 or once the quarry deck is exhausted.
142043.name: Stack and Attack

142044.name: Find the Treasure
142044.description:
Game published in The Jolly Play Book.

Rules:
'A Fascinating Board Game'
In this game, you and a friend each try to reach the Treasure. All you need to play this game are two buttons and a coin. Get buttons which are different in colour, for one button will be your marker, and the other button will be your friend's marker.

You both place your buttons in the Starting Box. The first player tosses up the coin. If the coin falls Heads, he advances his button two spaces; if it falls Tails, he advances his button one space.
The players take turns. Each player, of course, follows the board directions. As you see, sometimes a player may have to go back a box or two; sometimes he may lose his next turn; and sometimes he may be lucky and advance a few boxes. That’s the fun of the game.
The player who reaches the Winning Box first, wins the game.

142045.name: StarDrive
142045.description:
User Summary

StarDrive is a 4X Space Strategy game set in a randomly-generated universe, featuring a number of unique races. Colonize planets, build shipyards, and deploy scouts to explore, trade with, and ultimately conquer the universe.

One of the unique features that sets StarDrive apart is its ship design and combat mechanics, which allow the player to build their own ship blueprints module by module. Unique ship styles can be created, from armed transporters to space stations that aren't stations at all - rather, gigantic orbital weapons platforms.

142046.name: Arrow Soccer

boardgameversion.207952: Naldrett F.A. Book for Boys Edition

142046.description:
Game published in the The F.A. Book for Boys 1954/55.

Rules:
All you need to play this football game are two counters and a die. Throw the die to see who kicks off first - highest begins. Then each player throws and moves in turn. When a player lands on the tail of an arrow he moves directly to the head of that arrow. The white arrows are good passes and take you more quickly to the goal. The black ones are free-kicks awarded against you and take you farther from the goal. If one player lands on top of another, this is a foul and he must go back 7 positions.

To score a goal, you must throw the exact number required to reach the ‘Goal’ circle. If a number is thrown that is too many, you must go backwards for the number left over and await your next turn before you can shoot again . . . and so on until you get the exact number to score.

Try seeing how many goals you can score against a friend in half-an-hour (you can, of course, make it longer if you like). You might also form a local league, but if so all games should be the same period. Whatever the time-limit, the most goals, wins.

142047.name: Envoyer: Die Weltretter (Comic Sammelband)
142047.description:
From the back of the issue:
Weltretter Sammelband Nr. 1 - Überarbeitete Fassung der chaotischen Heldengruppe und ihrer Abenteuer!

Was können ein friedlicher Krieger, ein blinder Dieb, ein schwuler Priester und ein unfähiger Magier schon gemeinsam haben, fragt ihr euch?

Richtig: nichts! mit einer Ausnahme - denn alle vier wollen die Welt retten. Und genau deshalb haben sich Grobi, Bruno, Detlef und Henning zusammengetan. Kein Zweifel, eines Tages werden sie uns alle vor furchtbarem Unglück bewahren!

Bis dahin ist es aber noch ein langer weeg, und der führt vorbei am Magier Elgrinster und seinen Prüfungen, einem furchtbaren Drachen, einem Zeittor, und schließlich an Borak, dem Urvater des Bösen und König Dumm-Bo, seinem Gegenspieler.

Und eine Prinzessin ist auch dabei!

Die Weltretter - eine nicht ganz so ernstzunehmende Heldentruppe, die zu allem bereit, aber zu nichts zu gebrauchen ist... und es doch immer wieder irgendwie schafft.

user summary
Collection of the humorous Weltretter comics from issues 1-38. A group of ready-for-anything, good-for-nothing adventurers has only one thing in common: they want to save the world.

142048.name: Gnomoria
142048.description:
Gnomoria is a sandbox village management game where you help lead a small group of gnomes, who have set out on their own, to thrive into a bustling kingdom! Anything you see can be broken down and rebuilt elsewhere. Craft items, build structures, set traps and dig deep underground in search of precious resources to help your gnomes survive the harsh lands. Build your kingdom and stockpile wealth to attract wandering gnomads to your cause, but be wary of also attracting enemies!

Source: The Developer Website.

142049.name: Envoyer: Szenarienband 2
142049.description:
User summary

The second Szenarienband special expands on the rules and game world of EASY ("Einfaches Anfänger-System YARG"). It focuses on pirates and nautical battles, offering three scenarios, setting material with maps, floor plans and adventure hooks, and optional tabletop rules for combat on sea.

142050.name: Manuganu
142050.description:
User Summary

Manuganu is a side-scrolling running game. There are 30 different themed levels.

142051.name: Aces of Luftwaffe
142051.description:
User Summary

A vertical scrolling shooter where the player plays a British pilot fighting against German planes in an alternate version of WW 2.

142052.description:
This is the second expansion to Krosmaster: Arena. It contains:


Four new figures (Percimol, Makum Bah, Naz Rael, Coa Gulary)
Four character cards
Four minimaps
Two token sheets
142052.name: Krosmaster: Arena – Exp #3 – Percimol Rules

142053.description:
Have you get used to the basic players? Their variants will raise new challenges: a better shooting guard and center, that will force you to watch the perimeter even more; a faster forward and center, that will reach the basket more easily; a shooting guard, that will create more pass lines...

This expansion contains 5 new players, in Red and Blue, to improve some or all of those already in BASKETmind. There are no new rules to learn, since they benefit from abilities that were already in the game, although in other player types. The expansion rulebook suggests two playing modes to introduce them, "Better Teams" and "Draft Game".

boardgameversion.207960: nestorgames English / French / Spanish first edition

142053.name: BASKETmind: The Special Players

142054.name: Gears of Time
142054.description:
User Summary

Gears of Time is a physic puzzle based on gears, cogs, ropes and chains.

142055.description:
This is the third expansion to Krosmaster: Arena. It contains:

Four new figures (Ally McZeal, Remington Smisse, Srammy, Fern Sock'em)
Four character cards
Four minimaps
Two token sheets
142055.name: Krosmaster: Arena – Exp #2 – Remington Style

142056.name: Mortal Skies 2
142056.description:
User Summary

Mortal Skies 2 is a vertical scrolling airplane shooter set in the year 1950 of an alternate version of WW 2.

142057.description:
Carcassonne is a tile-placement game in which the players draw and place a tile with a piece of southern French landscape on it. The tile might feature a city, a road, a cloister, grassland or some combination thereof, and it must be placed adjacent to tiles that have already been played, in such a way that cities are connected to cities, roads to roads, etcetera. Having placed a tile, the player can then decide to place one of his meeples on one of the areas on it: on the city as a knight, on the road as a robber, on a cloister as a monk, or on the grass as a farmer. When that area is complete, that meeple scores points for its owner.

During a game of Carcassonne, players are faced with decisions like: "Is it really worth putting my last meeple there?" or "Should I use this tile to expand my city, or should I place it near my opponent instead, giving him a hard time to complete his project and score points?" Since players place only one tile and have the option to place one meeple on it, turns proceed quickly even if it is a game full of options and possibilities.

This big box includes the basic game, Inns & Cathedrals, Traders & Builders, Princess & Dragon and The Tower. The English version also has The River.
142057.name: Carcassonne Big Box

142058.name: Mortal Skies
142058.description:
User Summary

Mortal Skies is a vertical scrolling airplane shooter set in the year 1944.

142059.name: Toons Summer Games 2012
142059.description:
User Summary

The game offers 12 different sport challenges. For each challenge the player takes the role of a different animal.

142060.description:
This is the fourth expansion to Krosmaster: Arena. It contains:

Four new figures (Cloud Knight, Klor Ofil, Dani O'Shun, Leaf Knight)
Four character cards
Four minimaps
Two token sheets
142060.name: Krosmaster: Arena – Exp #4 – Earth and Wind

142061.name: The Travelers' Daughter
142061.description:
From publisher blurb:

While traveling one night, the party makes an unfortunate encounter, as a desperate mother find their camp and begs for their assistance; her young daughter has been taken in the night and her husband took off after them. Fearful for the safety of both, she has also raced through the woods, seeking assistance. And yet, not all is as it would appear as the party explores deeper and deeper into the woods in the dead of night. What really happened at the travelers' campsite? Who or what are the kidnappers and what do they want? And what shadows seem to be stalking the party through the woods?

The Travelers' Daughter is a Pathfinder OGL 3.5 adventure designed for 2-6 player characters, levels 1-3. This adventure features a little more combat than many Shadowglade adventures, but a reasonable amount of role-playing an deduction as well. Product includes two (2) 6x6 battle grids for use in the adventure.

142062.name: Witch Grand Hexes
142062.description:
From publisher blurb:

Sometimes, all you need to have fun with a class for another few months is a few new ideas to tinker around with. Class Expansions is a series of lightweight supplements for The Pathfinder Roleplaying Game that takes a base class and offers alternative class features that, handily enough, each fit on one page or less.

Following in this vein, Class Expansions: Witch Grand Hexes introduces eight new witch grand hexes, several of which have the distinction of being absolute walls o' text.

Cauldronborn - The witch can create a mass of protoplasm that grows into a replacement body should she ever die. Her spirit is capable of merging with this new body, causing there to be no loss of mental continuity, as is typically a problem with similar methods.
Cut the Thread - Everything in the world is tethered to the ever-spun tapestry of history by the tiniest of threads. The witch can see them; what's more, she can cut them. With but a touch, the witch can make those who truly anger her experience a fate worse than death. Their actions simply don't matter to the universe anymore.
Distilled Life - By brewing an elixir containing a small child as the key material component, the witch can cheat death for another decade or so.
Dream Possession - The witch can reach out and mentally dominate people when they sleep.
Master Herbalist - The witch's poultices can raise the dead.
Sacricficial Crow - The witch's familiar becomes incorporeal. Should it ever be destroyed, it reforms 24 hours later at the witch's side.
Touch of Witchcraft - Being the lazy slob that it is, the witch's patron empowers her with the ability to pick the next generation of witch. In return for her services, she gains a wish.
Withering - A few truly terrifying witches can cause creatures to wither in mere moments. So potent is her magic that the spell accelerates should the victim attempt to thwart it.

142063.description:
Deadzone is a dynamic tabletop miniatures skirmish game set in the distant sci-fi universe of Warpath in which two players take command of a crack team of upgradable elite troopers from one of four factions including powerful heroes, troopers, heavy weapons and specialists. You can even upgrade your troopers by collecting equipment and new weapons from the Battlefield, such as Machineguns, medipacks, grenades and more. But beware – you could be triggering a booby trap!

Featuring beautiful models from some of the most talented sculptors in the world, Deadzone marries the frantic action and fun of a tabletop game with the simplicity and elegance of a board game to create a truly innovative experience. With the Deadzone box, players take control of either the stalwart Enforcers or the horrific Plague, battling it out over scarce resources by combining deadly actions and an innovate Battle Card deck to lethal effect. Shoot to kill or claw your way through flesh as it doesn't matter how many should die in this urban landscape so long as players achieve their objectives.

All of this is set against a sci-fi backdrop brought to life using a grid-based gaming mat depicting the urban warzone that can be built up using Barricades and Buildings from the new modular Mantic Scenery Range, adding a vertical dimension to your games. No two games need ever be the same!
142063.name: Deadzone

142064.name: Glamour
142064.description:
Players assume the role of fairytale princesses getting ready for the ball - Cinderella, Rapunzel, Snow White and Sleeping Beauty. They move around the board collecting dresses, shoes, accessories and make-up, combining them on their personal "princess board" to create a look. Their looks will earn them "glamour points" if items correspond to the fashion trends defined by the fashion towers.
Players must move they princesses according to dice rolls, and lead towards on of the 4 fashion towers - each of them corresponding to one type of item. The princess collects these items and may wear them, combining them so as to be as fashionable as possible. Cards on top of the towers are kept revealed, and indicate which is the current fashion trend - which also means that when you reach a tower and collect the item, a new one will start a new trend. There are four different possible trends for each of the four item types, and they form four sets of items (each set has it's own shoe, make-up, dress and accessory).
The game is a roll-and-move, with special spaces along the board that may help of hinder the princess and bifurcations to minimize the luck component. When a princess arrives at the Ball, the space in the middle of the board, she compares her fashion items to those on the towers, and get a glamour point for each match (but loses the item on doing so). If she have all items of a set, she gets points for them all, ignoring the fashion trends.
The game ends when the first of the towers run out of items, which means a winning player may speed up the ending. When it happens, the princess with most glamour points wins the game and the heart of prince charming.

142065.description:
This is the fifth expansion to Krosmaster: Arena. It contains:

Four new figures (Di Curey, Boo Ming, Goultard, Bill Tell*)
Four character cards
Four minimaps
Two token sheets




*previously released in base set
142065.name: Krosmaster: Arena – Exp #5 – Goultard Control

142066.name: NOD (Issue 19 - Mar 2013)

rpg.19615: Blood & Treasure Fantasy Role Playing Game

142066.description:
From publisher blurb:

Spring has sprung, and so has NOD 19 (okay, that was lame, but this descriptive text gets tricky after a while). Anyhow - NOD 19 features the first half of the Virgin Woode hex crawl, a bunch of monsters, the puritan class, four new classes for Space Princess, a new race/class for Pars Fortuna and a bunch of other cool junk! 68 pages of excellence!

142067.name: Penguin Pals' Passing Puzzle
142067.description:
Each player will lead a team of penguins through an icy passage to reach the other, colder, side.
Each player must lead his 5 penguin pals to the opposing side of a 5x5 board. Each space may or may not contain an ice block, and penguins may only land on these blocks, but may swim across one iceless space. Players take turns in which they either move a penguin, move an ice block or draw action cards, which anyone can play at any time.
The goal is to be the first to get all five penguins across, which requires you to move forward while blocking the others' passage.

142068.name: Shape Up!
142068.description:
Circles, triangles or squares? Solid or hollow? Red, green or blue?

Your challenge is to play cards to fill the grid and line up the shapes that will score you the most points — while trying to stop your opponent doing exactly the same thing!

142069.description:
This is the sixth expansion to Krosmaster: Arena. It contains:


Four figures (Lil Healey*, Anna Tommy*, Fraktor, Victor Don Voom)
Four character cards
Four minimaps
Two token sheets


*previously released in base set
142069.name: Krosmaster: Arena – Exp #6 – Close Quarters

142070.name: A Way with Words
142070.description: Each player chooses a color. Players then take turns placing a vowel tile of his or her color on the board until all the vowels have been placed. The remaining letter tiles of all the colors are mixed together. Each player then draws three tiles, and players alternate placing one tile on the board and scoring for any forward or backward words, including embedded words, created by the placement. Words of a single color --- your color or an opponent's --- score more. Each player replenishes his hand following the placement. Play to an agreed-upon number of points.

142071.name: Flick Your Chip
142071.description: The board features spaces numbered sequentially from 1 to 100. Each player selects a marker and a chip of a given color and places his or her marker on 50. An initial flick of the chip indicates the direction in which a player will move. Subsequent movement is determined by cards. Players take turns drawing a card, and all players must move according to the dictates of each card. Some cards require you to flick your chip or to invert your chip before you move; other cards give you a choice, such as either moving the distance indicated on the card or taking your chances with a dice roll. The first player to move past either 1 or 100 on the board is the winner.

142072.description:
This is the eighth expansion to Krosmaster: Arena. It contains:

Four figures (Bad Aboum*, Kassius Kaos*, Clot The Crapulous, Shak Shaka)
Four character cards
Four minimaps
Two token sheets




*previously released in base set
142072.name: Krosmaster: Arena – Exp #8 – Shak Attack

142073.description:
This is the seventh expansion to Krosmaster: Arena. It contains:

Four new figures (Quentin Flush, Luk Ylook, Oscar Kass*, Darkness Knight)
Four character cards
Four minimaps
Two token sheets




*previously released in base set
142073.name: Krosmaster: Arena – Exp #7 – Bad Boys

142074.name: Artful Deductions
142074.description: The game comes with seven packets of cards, 26 cards per packet. The front of each card depicts a work of art, and the back contains a question in one of five categories: Language, Science & Technology, Government & Religion, Daily Life, and Warfare. Players attempt to deduce the answer to each question based upon (1) the picture on the front, (2) clues within the question, and (3) the category. Points are scored for correct answers. The game ends when all the questions in a packet have been read.

142075.name: Activision Anthology (GBA)

videogameversion.208002: North American Game Boy Advance edition

142075.description:
User Summary

A compilation of Activision games. The GBA release has a different set of games than the other consoles.

142076.name: Monopoly: Sonic the Hedgehog Collector's Edition
142076.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Vvrrrrm! The world's fastest hedgehog is teaming up with America's favorite trading game to bring you MONOPOLY: Sonic the Hedgehog Collector's Edition. Grab your token - Sonic, Tails, or even Chao - and zip around the board faster than the speed of sound! Buy, sell and trade your favorite zones, from Green Hill to Mad Gear. Own stages like Apotos, Metal City and Sand Ruin, and improve them with Workshops or Bases. Then, triumph over your competition by collecting more rings from other players! Think you can own it all? Ready... GO!

142077.name: Monopoly: Brave Collector's Edition
142077.description:
Publisher Blurb:

The Brave Collector's Edition of Monopoly follows the heroic journey of Merida through the rugged Scottish Highlands. From the private chambers of DunBroch Castle where Merida first defies tradition, to the Wise Woman's cottage, where she is granted her ill-fated wish, join the adventure with King Fergus, Queen Elinor and the mischievous triplets as you buy, sell and trade your way through the kingdom and learn the true meaning of bravery. The game is based off of Pixar 's first fairy tale film, Brave and is released by Walt Disney Pictures.

142078.name: Kung Fu Rabbit
142078.description:
"Life in the temple of rabbits hangs by a thread. Universal Evil has struck again and kidnapped all of your disciples. Only you managed to escape. They let you live… They’ll soon regret it!

Use your agility and combat skills to save your disciples! Jump from roof to roof, slide gracefully along walls, sneak up on your enemies, and rip them to shreds!

Detailed graphics, humor, hours of gameplay and intuitive controls. Each of the 80 levels requires logic, precision, agility and Kung Fu Rabbit mastery.

Kill the Evil and save the babies, eat the carrots and unlock trophies!


80 levels in normal and hard mode (dozen hours of play!)
15 unlockable items to customize your rabbit."


Source: The Publisher Website.

168589.name: Space Cadets: Dice Duel Drive Thru Promo

boardgamehonor.24518: 2013 Golden Geek Best Party Board Game Nominee

142079.description:
Your plan is quickly coming together. Simplicity itself. Just continue to close the gap to the enemy, and launch when within range. Your crew is well-trained and work quickly at their stations, just the edge you need to come out on top.

“Engineering, power to Helm. Move forward and close the distance to the enemy. Keep shields in the front. We're going straight in”. You can feel the bridge vibrate slightly as the engines come up to speed.

“Captain, all sensors are on weapon lock”, says the Sensor Officer. “You can fire at will.”

A slight smirk crosses your face. “On my mark! Launch both tor... Wait, where did they go?” You look at the viewscreen, puzzled, with a growing sense of unease.

Sensors starts shouting. “Crystal Warp! Captain they've done a crystal warp and they're directly behind us!”

From your right comes the panicked voice of the Shields officer. “Umm, Captain... All of our shields are to the front!”

You start barking out orders. “Shields, use the crystal we captured to raise the aft shield. Weapons, start to move the torpedoes to the rear tubes! Helm, get us out of here!”

The crew gets to work, but you look on in horror as two torpedoes lance out from your nemesis...

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Space Cadets: Dice Duel – the "Team vs. Team, Real-time, Dice-Rolling Game of Starship Combat!" – pits two spaceships against one another in quick-paced combat. The players are divided into two teams, each team playing the crew of a ship and winning or losing together based on how well they perform. The game ends when one side destroys their opponent by causing four points of damage through torpedoes or mines. Each ship has six Bridge Stations:


Engineering generates power for the other stations.
Helm maneuvers the ship on the map.
Weapons loads the torpedo tubes to attack the enemy.
Sensors locks onto the enemy so torpedoes can hit, and uses jammers to stop the enemy from locking on.
Shields helps protect the ship from enemy torpedoes.
Tractor Beams can grab the powerful crystals, move the enemy ship on the map, and launch Mines.


Each player is in charge of one or more of these stations, or has the overall role of Captain to coordinate everything. There are no game turns in Space Cadets: Dice Duel; instead the game continues with players acting as quickly as possible until one side wins.
142079.name: Space Cadets: Dice Duel

142080.name: FAITH
142080.description:
Publisher blurb:

1 BIOLOGICAL WEAPON
4 PEOPLE AT A CROSSROADS
8 MILLION REASONS SOMEONE'S ABOUT TO HAVE A VERY BAD DAY

Forget politeness and good manners, there's no honor amongst thieves. Designed to be picked up and played instantly, FAITH is a collaborative storytelling game for four players. With no technical rules or overly complex structures, it's an ideal introduction to roleplaying. And with a solid set-up, wide open second act, and tight finale FAITH lets seasonsed roleplayers get downright unsavory.

Consistently producing engrossing tales through a flexible framework, FAITH remains infinitely replayable.

Welcome to Faith. Population: you!

FAITH is a collaborative storytelling game for four players inspired by the films of Quentin Tarantino, particularly From Dusk Till Dawn and Reservoir Dogs.

Designed to play out in approximately three hours, it’s ideal for game nights, last-minute pick-up sessions, and convention slots.

Its minimalistic design also makes it an ideal introduction for people new to roleplaying.

Despite its overall simplicity, the solid set-up and tight finale, when coupled with a wide-open second act, mean FAITH not only consistently produces engrossing tales but is infinitely replayable.

142081.name: Star Trek Tactics: Movie Mini-Game
142081.description: In Star Trek Tactics: Movie Mini-Game, players go head-to-head, with one or two players controlling Captain James T. Kirk and Mr. Spock and trying to repel a Klingon assault on the U.S.S. Enterprise. The other player controls the Klingons, of course, and wants to see Spock and Kirk reduced to atoms floating between the stars.

142082.name: First Queen
142082.description:
First Queen (ファーストクイーン?, "First Queen") is a real-time strategy-action RPG video game developed by Kure Software Koubou. It was first released on the Sharp X68000 and NEC PC-9801 computer platforms in Japan in 1988, and then subsequently released on the Super Famicom as First Queen: Ornic Senki in 1994 and Microsoft Windows as First Queen 1 in 2001. The game had three sequels. The series was also notable for featuring art work by Yoshitaka Amano, who would later gain fame for the Final Fantasy series.

Source: Wikipedia, "First Queen", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

142084.description:
Kings of Israel is a board game taking place in Israel (the Northern Kingdom) during the reign of its kings up until Israel's destruction by Assyria. Players are on a team, with each person representing a line of prophets that are trying to remove evil and idols from Israel, while building altars to help guide Israel in the upcoming difficult years. If the players are able to build enough altars before the game ends, they win. If the game ends by either the team running out of sin cubes or idols, or by Assyria destroying Israel, the prophets lose.

A typical round has four phases:

1. King's Godliness Phase: During this phase, if a bad king is reigning over Israel, the players must draw a Sin & Punishment card, which means bad things occur in Israel because of evil or in response to evil. If during the reign of a good king, the starting player receives a Blessing card.

2. Sin Increases Phase: Location cards are drawn and sin increases at each revealed location. This can possibly cause idols to appear or sin to spread further if sin increases at a location with an idol.

3. Prophets Work Phase: In this phase each prophet gets to use four actions to accomplish their goals. They may use their actions to move, remove sin or idols, draw resource cards, build an altar, make a sacrifice at an altar, or to give resources to another player. A prophets may also play Blessing cards at this time if they have them. In expert mode, after all the prophets take their turn, the false prophet takes his turn.

4. End of Round Phase: The starting player changes to the next player and the timeline token moves down to the next king chronologically. In easy mode, any player who had made a sacrifice that turn then draws a single Blessing card.

The family version of Kings of Israel is available on the game's website. This version eliminates the King's Godliness phase, Abilities, and the Blessing cards, which makes for an easier, quicker, and more simplified game.
142084.name: Kings of Israel

142085.description:
Promised Land: 1250-587 BC is a history of the Promised Land from Joshua through to the Babylonian captivity. Players compete in two teams, out of which just one individual will be crowned the winner. Hebrew units are split between Northern and Southern kingdoms, but Hebrew players will have the opportunity to use both these factions through the game. Similarly there are eleven Heathen kingdoms for the Heathen players to use. Play happens at an individual, human level as well as at the movement of nations level.

Each player has two Farmers, two Merchants and two Priests. A number of these can be placed after conquest into lands occupied by the kingdom just played. Farmers collect two bronze coins for plains and one for hills. Merchants collect two silver coins for ports and one for roads. Priests collect two gold coins for temples and one for cities. Players may have only one of their Patriarchs in any one land. Players may share occupation of a land, but only one type of Patriarch may be in each land.

Players use the coins generated by their Patriarchs to buy artefacts that influence game play but can instead choose to secure objectives on the Kingdom track to highlight the development of the nation and score victory points of course! A variety of strategies are available, and players must make choices throughout the game in order to emerge victorious.
142085.name: Promised Land: 1250-587 BC

142086.description: An Overlay to help keep your Hit Location Cubes from accidental movement. This Overlay is made from 1/8" clear laser cut acrylic. It was designed to enhance game play and respect the beautiful graphics of this game.
142086.name: Merchants & Marauders Hit Location Overlay

142087.name: de Blob (iOS)
142087.description:
User Summary

You control de Blob in an attempt to return color to Chroma City and defeat the I.N.K.T. Corporation. You roll, jump, grow, shrink, and change color to meet objectives as you paint the city. This version uses the accelerometer to control de Blob.

142088.name: de Blob Revolution
142088.description:
User Summary

This game is a different spin on the de Blob series. In this game, de Blob goes inside the buildings of Chroma City to rescue the citizens one by one. The goal of the game is for de Blob to find the best way through mazes to rescue as many graydians as he can without crossing his own path. Bonuses are awarded for rescuing all of the graydians on a level, solving the mazes under a set time limit, or avoiding hordes of INKT enemies. de Blob is controlled by drawing or tapping on the screen.

142089.name: Panzer Corps Grand Campaign Mega Pack '39 - '45
142089.description:
The Mega Pack features all the 10 linked campaigns bundled in one huge package. The player will have the chance to play all 150+ scenarios covering the entire war from the invasion of Poland and Norway on to the cold Russian winter against the Red Army on the East front, defend against D-Day and then take a final stand at Berlin.

Players can import their core force between the linked campaigns, or alternatively use a preset core force and play each of the campaigns on its own or jump in at any year. Gain skills and new equipment for your troops, lead them in a huge campaign map face the enemy and try to overturn your fate

Source: The Publisher Website.

142090.name: Hills and Rivers Remain
142090.description:
Hills and Rivers Remain is a video game developed and published by Square Enix and released for the iPhone and iPod Touch in North America and Japan, and additionally for DSIWare and cell phones in Japan. The game was released in November 2009, and has seen many map expansions released. The game is a strategy game that incorporates turn-based and real-time elements. It sees the player controlling several forts in a group of connected bases, choosing each round which base will create new forces that are used to attack enemy positions.

Players navigate their characters across a map attempting to take their opponent's bases. The map is set up as a grid of connected forts, with each player controlling a section of the map. The game is turn-based; each turn the player selects one of their bases to be their main base. At the end of each turn, the main base spawns troops. The amount of forces created depends on the number of held bases. The player then sends these troops either towards their own bases to reinforce them or towards enemy bases in order to capture them. Troops do not travel instantly, allowing circumstances to change at the target base before they arrive. Capturing bases is done by comparing the attacking troops' numbers with the defending, with larger numbers winning. Some bases provide additional bonuses to the side that holds them, such as increased movement speed or attack power. The match ends when one player controls the entire map. Each match takes around ten to twenty minutes to complete. The player can face multiple enemies at once.

Source: Wikipedia, "Hills and Rivers Remain", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

142091.name: Run Roo Run
142091.description:
Run Roo Run follows a mother kangaroo traveling across Australia from Perth to Sydney in search of her captured Joey.

Hop, skip, and jump your way across unique obstacles in the Australian outback! Run Roo Run is a micro-platformer featuring single screen levels and easy to learn, one-touch gameplay. Play for a few minutes, or a few hours; your journey to Sydney always picks up where you left off!

Discover unique abilities like double jump, ridable clouds, gravity-defying umbrellas, invisibility, tire swings, and more to get through over 20 chapters with 15 basic levels and 6 extreme mode levels each. Share your scores with friends in this Game Center-enabled title.

Source: The Game Website.

142092.description:
Monster Zoo is a 2-4 player casual deck-building game / zoo management game.

In Monster Zoo, you are a Zoo Keeper catching monsters in the wild for your Zoo - while trying to prevent other players from doing the same.

Each turn you will be collecting new monsters, using monsters to help you catch even more monsters, and managing the monsters in your Zoo.

Players start off with the same deck of cards. Over the course of the game, as you catch monsters, you will build a stronger and more resourceful deck. You will need to balance building a stronger deck along with building up your Zoo. Placing monster cards from your hand into your Zoo earns points, but monsters in your Zoo will no longer play an active role in your deck.

With over 30 unique monsters cards in the base game, there is a wide variety to the actions and combinations you'll see during a typical game.

The first player to build a full Zoo wins!
142092.name: Monster Zoo

142093.name: Skelebone's Model Game Entry
142093.description:
This is where the description of the game should go. This should contain information about the theme, game-play, and goal of the game.

Links to expansions and re-implementations formerly went in this box, but they now have relevant places in the header information, so they should no longer go here.

Bolded additional fields that are still used on this page are Integrates with:, and much more infrequently Similar to: , though items that have substantial similarities might be collected into a family

142094.name: Leviathan War Galleon
142094.description:
User Comment

A set of 8"x11" sheets which have cut-out images which can be assembled into a Galleon Ship map gridded in 1" squares.

142095.name: The Great Aleph Beis Race Game
142095.description:
The Great Aleph Beis Race Game is designed to teach children the Hebrew alphabet.

Players are given a card showing a Hebrew word and they must find the hidden letters on the board which make up this word. The game board displays a town through which players must race their cars (player tokens) in order to collect the Hebrew letters. Using a spinner, players travel along coloured paths which direct them to the hidden letters.

The first player to complete the word on their card and return to the starting point wins the game.

142097.name: Ciber: IT's all in the game
142097.description:
In IT's All In The Game you try to place your consultants at the best positions with ongoing projects. The better you do this, the more points you score each round.

Meanwhile you have to keep an eye on the deadlines. And try to stop other players from making you lose your consultants for the rest of the game.

Every playing round exists of more action rounds. At the start of each playing round you receive 2 senior consultants (playing cards). In your turn you can perform 1 action.

Actions:
- Place 1 consultant with a project
- Move 1 consultant from a project to another project.
- Pay 2 points and a consultant. Choose another consultant (without the other players seeing which one).
- Pay 2 points and a consultant. 'Upgrade' this consultant to a principal of the same color. Show other players this principal.
- Pay 6. Same action as above, but withouth showing any card to the other players.
- Pass.

A project has 5 phases. Consultants have to be placed first at the 1st phase. Only then can a consultant be placed with the second phase. And so on.
The last or the last two consultants always have to be principals.

If a project is finished (that is consultant for phase 5 has been played) it is scored, the project and the consultants are put at the discard pile. A new project is then placed on the table.

Once all players have passed, the playing round is over and points are scored.

Every project is scored. Points being awarded 6/4/2/1 (later 10/6/4/2). The further towards the end of the project a consultant lies, the more points it generates.

After scoring all cards remain with the projects. Players can therefore score multiple times for the same consultant.

IT's All In The Game in a few words:
- Lots of interaction.
- Tactical choices.
- Basic game with two expansions.
- Unexpected depth.

For now it is only available with Dutch game rules.

142098.name: 100 floors
142098.description:
User Summary

100 floors is a puzzle game where you have open doors. Each level consits of a picture of a door and its surroundings. To do that you have pinch, poke, shake, tilt, swipe the on-screen images to find a way to solve the puzzles.

142100.name: Dr. Arch's Mutations
142100.description: Each player begins with a card that represents one of four strains of bacteria. Each player maintains a hand of five cards that can include mutation cards that will permit the player to grow other players' strains in addition to his own. Other cards are random events, antibiotics (used to interfere with other players' cultures), and bacteria (used to help grow one's own cultures). Players play one or more cards on their turns, and play continues until all cards have been played. Players receive points based on the success of their cultures and a bouns if they have grown all four cultures.

142101.name: Gravi
142101.description:
Gravi is an intense puzzle-platformer that will test your tolerance for pain. Shoot and swing your way towards victory as Gravi, an adorable blue ball of energy. While you're launching through terrorizing traps and bending gravity to your will, Anti-Gravi, an atomic ball of rage, is barreling down on your position.​
​
After losing yourself in the ridiculously trap-filled underbelly of an alien test facility, you must use your wits and perseverance to solve a series of perplexing puzzles. Along the way, your limits will be put to the test by all sorts of absurdly dangerous hazards.
​
Snatch up collectibles and fight off Anti-Gravi on your path to freedom. If you can survive Gravi's 40 unique levels and best Anti-Gravi at his own game, you just might make it out alive.

Source: The Developer Website.

142102.name: Grimind
142102.description:
You have no memories...

You don't know who you are...

You don't know where you are...

That's all I can tell you right now.

Grimind is a 2D physics based adventure/platform game with a horror/creepy theme. Grimind casts you into forgotten caves and ancient crypts, without memories. While there you have to demonstrate great manual skills to pass obstacles and solve puzzles to get out of the scary environment and discover what are you doing there alone. But is it certain ... that you are there ... alone?

Features:
- Dynamic gameplay combined with a frightening experience.
- Physics-based gameplay - It gives you the possibility to do whatever you want. Every single dynamic object can be dragged, carried or thrown which gives you enormous freedom.
- Narration - While playing, the character is talking, telling the player what he feels, if he's scared, or what he thinks about the current situation.
- Challenge! - Grimind isn't an easy game, so you can forget about holding just one key and passing through the levels. Besides dexterity and input skills, there are also a large number of logic puzzles to solve. Your brain will be tested and you'll not get bored.

Source: The Developer Website.

142103.name: Guess What!
142103.description: The game comes with 108 flat pieces of different shapes and sizes. Players take turns drawing a card that contains six items and then, within a time limit and using any of the pieces, creating the item that matches a die roll. The other players attempt to guess what is being created, and they may ask for the first letter of the item. Creator and correct guesser score either two points (no first-letter clue) or one point (clue given). Play until each player has constructed five items.

142104.name: Reversion Chapter 1: The Escape
142104.description:
User Summary

You are in a hospital in Buenos Aires. You aren't sure how you arrived there. You're shocked to learn that it isn't 2015, but 2035, and that Buenos Aires is now in the hands of a paramilitary organization. The hospital serves as that organization's headquarters, and once they learn of your existence, they become eager to meet you. Maybe too eager....

142105.name: Reversion Chapter 2: The Meeting
142105.description:
User Summary

It's the year 2035, and you have no memory of the last 20 years of your life. Having escaped from the hospital/paramilitary organization's headquarters in Buenos Aires, you and your friend Victoria are looking to find the person in a photo you possess. Hopefully that person will help you recover your memories and start you down the path to understanding why you are there....

142106.name: Mario and Donkey Kong: Minis on the Move
142106.description:
"If you’re a fan of action-puzzle game play, Mario and Donkey Kong: Minis on the Move is coming to the Nintendo 3DS eShop soon. Race against the clock to create paths and get the Mini-Marios to the goal. The game feature multiple puzzle modes as well as unlockable mini-games. You’ll want to learn each game mode and then master the puzzles, which in turn, will help turn you into an expert puzzle creator yourself, as the game will include a robust system for creating and sharing your own puzzle content."

Source: The Publisher/Developer Website.

142107.name: Mage Clash
142107.description:
Long ago in Seven Cities of Gray, two adepts began a journey to learn forbidden majicks. Over three ages they created magical objects and potions, translated arcane cantrips, and discovered lost artifacts of four ancient mages: Arden, Balor, Canna and Dynin. In time their powers grew to the point where they, and their allies, fought each other with spells and wards across the Seven Cities for the title of Master Mage!

Mage Clash is a game for 2 players, lasting about 30 to 45 minutes.

Players will need the tiles and cards for the game, 5 six-sided dice, a set of traditional D&D dice and 80 eurocubes in 2 colors.

The game is played in two phases.

During the first phase - Learning Majick - players will play tiles (Magic Items, Mystic Objects, Magic Spells, Casting Wards, Potions and Cantrips) from their hands by paying Elemental Resource costs. Each type of tile has a different power associated with it and the collection of sets allows a player to gain victory points or have the choice of Special Artifacts to be used in the second phase. Discard tiles boost a players army and mana abilities.

The first phase lasts eight rounds and mid-game victory points scored
